Lincolnshire Poacher: made from unpasteurised milk from Holstein cows.
Lincolnshire poacher has a similar earthy flavour to Cheddar but has a more open texture, it is pale yellow in colour and has an inedible grainy brown rind.
It won a gold medal at the British Cheese Awards in 2001
and is available from the service counter at the Daventry and Newark branches of Waitrose.
Uses: It is suitable for grating and grilling
or can be served in chunks
with pickled onions and crusty bread for a quick lunch.
To eat: If serving on a cheeseboard remove the cheese from the fridge an hour before serving, to allow it to come to room temperature and to develop its full texture and flavour.
